1312221.content:
Mallory Daniels stood quietly at the foot of the stairs leading to her house's front door for a few moments. She didn't know how long exactly she had stood there, not moving, not taking her eyes off the doorway, or the knob, or even the somewhat faded stained color that once held a warmth in the house that now was strikingly empty.

Mallory felt more than a bit empty inside as her eyes traced over the numerical figures that adorned the eaves above the door, the nails holding them showing the beginning signs of rust while cobwebs tangled in the corners of the overhang. How could anyone driving by this house and think that anything other than a dysfunctional family inhabited those very rooms was beyond her. Anyone that knew them, that knew the Daniels family, would have known nothing but love, but happiness and cheer. Anyone that knew them then would not even begin to know them now.

She was supposed to be a bit young to understand what exactly had happened, but it wasn't all that hard to figure it out. Dad had worked hard at his job, burning long hours and stressing over finances, all while her mother had spent the day on her back, her legs spread open, and had slept with countless men. There were rumors going around that some of her lovers had even been women. The adults all whispered, as if holding up a hand would make her deaf to their conversations. Their averted glances would shield her from knowing they were talking and pointing at them. "How sad..." they would say and she would fume internally, wondering how exactly she should stand there and take it.

But, no, the anger would go away. She remembered aching when she saw the toll it took on her father, Jarrod Daniels, and how he struggled every day to put food on the table, to make sure they could keep the house that she had grown up in, and to make things right for her. She wanted to scream "enough, daddy!" but she knew, deep down she knew, that the work kept him busy and kept him from suffering any more from the betrayal and the sheer mockery that her mother had made of his dedication and love. The divorce had been simple, been quick, and she had seen that woman speed off in a car, not even turning around to look one last time, the next boytoy chomping to get at her bits.

That had been 2 years ago, today. Mallory looked down at the small bluish sapphire that she had picked up on the way home from school. It was a simple stone, something that had caught her eyes, and she somehow felt that it was appropriately given to her father. I want him to have it...to realize that life isn't always that bad... She smiled as she imagined the warmth radiating from the stone in her hand. It was a good gift to give him.
1312221.title: She's 11 years old

13122211.content:
Jarrod looked up from the mound of paperwork on his desk as Mallory's footsteps on the wooden paneling echoed through the otherwise quiet house. She smiled and walked over to her father and wrapped her arms around his shoulders and squeezed, a bit too tightly, but still with all the love she could muster. "Hey, sweetheart. How was school?"

She filled him in as he cleared a part of the table off for her to rest her arms on and with a nod, leaned back in his chair. "...and, by the way..." she held out her hand and placed the stone into his outstretched palm. "I found this for you. I wanted you to have it."

Jarrod looked at the stone and imagined that the warmth that he felt in his hand was from the love and tenderness that his daughter intended. "Thank you."

Jarrod always felt that he had spent way too long in the office and never enough with Mallory. It wasn't so much that he had to provide for his family (even though that bitch of a wife TOOK most of the money he brought home, causing him to have to work more and more overtime) but there had to be more to life than just sitting down at a desk, burying himself up to his eyes in transaction reports, and worrying about deadlines and profit margins. He didn't allow himself to think what would have happened to his marriage if he had taken a slower, more paced course at work, but there were moments when he would've done things a bit differently.

I'm glad that I got to keep her but still, all that time wasted...

He smiled as they got ready to head into town for dinner that night, a bit of extra cash had made its way into his pocket and he was damned if this wasn't a good reason to get out and spend some time. The stone glimmered in his eye and, with another smile, he tucked the little rock into his pocket next to his wallet and keys.

"Ready to go, daddy?"
1312221112.title: To be closer to his daughter

13122211121.content: Jarrod stepped out from the house as he watched Mallory scamper down the stairway leading to their car. It wasn't a brand-new car but, for what it needed to do, it was a good commuter and got him from point A to B well enough. He plipped twice to unlock all the doors and turned around, inserting the key to lock the door. As he turned the key, the keyring seemed to become a bit lighter in his hands as several keys slowly detached from the ring and slipped out of his hand quietly. Simple keys to various drawers and to rooms at work that he wouldn't be needing for much longer.
13122211121.title: Heading to the car

choices: It's his friend from work, Timothy
131222112.title: A visitor drops by

choices: Mallory invites Allan to come along...and he accepts!
1312221121.content:
Mallory looked up from her spot on the porch as their neighbor Allan Manning called out to Jarrod. Allan was a young banking executive that had moved into the house next door to them two years earlier and had always smiled, had a good story to share, and was very approachable to all of the kids on the block. He was the type that reminded her of what her father had once been, before the marriage had gone south, and she secretly wondered whether Allan would be able to help her father become happy and content once more.

"Hey Jarrod, Mallory! How's things going?"

Jarrod returned the smile. "Going well. Taking this little one out for a special night on the town. It's been too long since we just went out and spent some time. Work, y'know..."

Allan nodded almost immediately. "I hear you. Heard that you were responsible for the Parker case? Tough one, man, glad that you could pull that one out of your hat like that."
1312221121.title: It's their neighbor, Allan

13122211211.content:
Before Jarrod could say anything, Mallory smiled and looked at her neighbor. "Mr. Manning, we're going out to dinner. Did you want to join us?"

"Mallory!"

Allan blinked a bit as Jarrod turned to look with an apologetic smile on his face but, for some reason, Jarrod seemed okay with the idea. "Yeah...well, the little one offered. Would you like to come?"

Allan went back into his house to change as Jarrod looked down at his daughter who was smiling up at him and gave his hand a warm squeeze. "Was that your idea all along?" She just shrugged and turned back as Mr. Manning came back out, dressed in a pair of dark jeans a tucked in blue polo shirt that matched his dark brown hair and neatly tanned skin perfectly.
13122211211.title: Mallory invites Allan to come along...and he ac...

choices: Chinese is good this time of the day
131222112111.content:
"Hey, since you invited me out, the least I can do is drive us there." Jarrod looked back towards his car for a moment before Mallory seemingly turned and pulled him towards the other man's car. While he drove a decent Honda Civic, Allan's black 5 Series definitely stood out in contrast. He remembered laughing a bit ruefully when Allan drove it in from picking it up at the dealership but now, for some reason, all he could think was that it had been a nice purchase.

Allan unlocked the doors and Mallory hopped into the back seat while Jarrod slipped into the passenger seat quite readily. The keys in his pocket seemed to get a bit slimmer still, unnoticed to him were several more keys had slipped off the changing key-ring until three were left and the loop closed up tightly.

"Okay...so, where shall we hit?"
131222112111.title: Allan offers to drive

choices: Conversation takes a slightly awkward turn
1312221121111.content:
Mallory looked momentarily at her father who was sitting in the passenger seat next to Mr. Manning and somehow knew that things would definitely be better now. How, exactly, was not yet known to her but it was just a gut feeling. "How about Assagio's? Dad, you love it there."

Jarrod blinked before he glanced over at Allan who, with his eyes on the road, cracked a smile and nodded. "That sounds fun, haven't been there in a while."

As Allan wove the car into traffic on the way to the shopping center, Jarrod glanced down at his hands for a moment before he slipped into conversation with Allan about his court cases. It was a very subtle change, barely noticeable to anyone but a particular set of eyes who took in everything that was happening to her father. Jarrod's normally sandy hair slowly began to turn a shade darker as his hair grew from the near crew-cut hairstyle that he kept, a hallmark from his marine father, to where it looked like he hadn't touched it in over a month.
1312221121111.title: Go for Italian

13122211211111.content:
The BMW turned onto the main trunk road that ran parallel to the highway which, at 5:30 on a Monday afternoon, was jammed solid with cars and trucks from the big businesses that were letting out for the day. It was a smaller road but since the locals knew about the highway problems, this side trip was just as long and just as congested.

Jarrod looked forward a bit, craning his neck, to see if there was any space in the lane next to them as Allan did the same to the opposite side, and neither really noticed that Jarrod's hair had grown slightly more to where it was a bit shaggy in the bag and more than a bit long on top, way out of any military standard cut that would've passed the Sergeant (her grandpa had little use for "civilian niceities", which may explain why her dad had gotten as far away in terms of marriage partners as he could've...a whole lot of good THAT did him.) It's light color turned a bit more fuller, from a pale yellow white to a gentle soft yellow. Wonder what Dad would look like as a blonde... she mused to herself as she sat back and rested contently against the leather upholstery.
13122211211111.title: it's rush hour traffic time

131222112111111.content: Jarrod pointed out a small but large enough space in the next lane that would lead to a side-road for them to take and Allan quickly took it. As they pulled out of the traffic and hit the sparsely packed road, the conversation between the two men continued back onto cases and comparing notes on familiar names. Jarrod ran a hand up to brush some hair away from his eyes, not noticing the darkening of the color or its length as the front part was easily tucked behind his ear while the back and the top became just a bit longer. For Mallory, it looked like a mop on top of her dad's head and, if he were paying any attention to it at all, he would be shocked and embarrassed. If he were, that is.
131222112111111.title: Jarrod finds a space

1312221121111111.content:
Getting to the restaurant was much faster and as Allan pulled into a stall, Mallory stretched and knocked the kinks out of her stiff neck. Unlike her seat in her dad's car, the BMW felt...well, odd. She looked up at her father who opened the door and stepped out, not noticing that the hair on his head had grown a bit again, now brushing the top of his neck and turning a nice, lush golden blonde hue.

"Glad we got here, traffic's usually not that bad," he muttered as Mallory stepped out and closed the door behind her. The three of them walked into the restaurant to find it, as they suspected pretty much packed full.
1312221121111111.title: They arrive at the restaurant

13122211211111111.content:
With luck (and incredible timing, apparently), there was an empty table and the three were led to it. As they walked, Jarrod's body slowly shrunk about an inch, leaving him at an even 6'0", about an inch taller than Allan was. As they were seated, his hair now fully covered the back of his neck and swished around on his shoulders with a few bangs appearing in the front. Jarrod didn't seem to notice as he moved the hair from his view of the menu a few times unconsciously, the formerly almost whitish yellow hue now a rich, lush golden blonde color.

"What's good? Haven't been here in a while," Allan whispered and Jarrod raised an eyebrow in Mallory's direction.

"Everything, really..." she responded nonchalantly, looking over the menu items before she settled on her favorite eggplant and feta cheese dish. She knew what her father would order and had a feeling that he wouldn't choose it this time around. The changes that were already showing were noticeable only because she had paid attention from the very beginning, likely to have missed it if she didn't.
13122211211111111.title: They're shown to a table

131222112111111111.content:
When the waiter came around, Allan motioned for Mallory to order first and she smiled, ordering the eggplant before handing the menu to the man. She watched as her father looked up from his seat and picked not the usual steak and blue cheese but a chicken scampi dish. It was definitely lighter on the palate and had just that bit of extra garlic. Definitely not what he would've ordered.

As Allan took his turn to order, Jarrod's skin tone slowly grew a shade darker, leaning from a generally pale color towards a tanned light bronze hue. His height went a bit lower, just by another inch, but he didn't seem to notice or mind as much.

"I'll be right back with some water and salads to go around," said the waiter before he left the table.
131222112111111111.title: Jarrod makes his choice...

1312221121111111111.content:
After water and the salads arrived, the three of them fell into a nice give and take conversation, mostly between the two adults as Mallory munched on her salad and kept to the background. Jarrod's skin had definitely turned a shade darker until it was a soft golden hue, very much fitting the Med in terms of complexion that matched his golden blonde hair, now freely cascading down his shoulders. His eyes were a different shade of blue than before, a darker but more vibrant color. It was unusual to see a man looking like that but no one seemed to notice: not the waiter, not the people walking past their table, and definitely neither Allan or Jarrod.

"Oops, I'll be right back," Jarrod said quickly before he excused himself from the table.
1312221121111111111.title: Small conversations, more changes occur

13122211211111111111.content: Jarrod made his way to the restroom, not noticing how his height had lowered again by another inch, hovering at 5'8" with a few more inches to go. His hair had a steady bounce to it as it swished and fell down the back of his head, resting quite nicely at the nape of his back. As he neared the restrooms, he paused for just the briefest of moments.
13122211211111111111.title: Jarrod heads to the restroom

choices: Jarrod makes it back to the table
131222112111111111111.content:
Pushing through the door to the restroom, he made his way past the sinks and past a few of the urinals that were otherwise occupied. Jarrod spotted one that was empty but instead made his way to a stall, hopping in and closing it behind him. He lowered his pants down and then, for some reason, turned and sat down to relieve himself. It seemed out of place for him to do that but he just shrugged and sighed at the slight pain that seemed to throb from his groin area and his lower stomach region.

After he was done, he reached down and gently shook himself clean, the tip of his fingernail brushing the tip of the head. His nails seemed to be a bit longer with a semi-shiny shimmer to them as they reflected the light from above. "That's strange..."
131222112111111111111.title: Entering the men's restroom

choices: The waiter has a curious issue for Jarrod
1312221121111111111111.content:
Taking a moment to wash his hands, Jarrod smiled to himself as he caught his reflection in the mirror. He was never one to brag but he had some rather flawless skin, soft to the touch, and with barely any blemishes. He was grateful for taking that from his mother's side, though it caused him to wonder for a moment about what exactly else did he take from her. His eyes slowly adjusted to the light, changing from its brown to a shade slightly on the bluish tint, barely noticeable at the moment.

With the smile still on his face, he turned and stepped around a guy who had rushed into the bathroom and nearly bumped into him. The guy mumbled his apologies and Jarrod nodded before pushing through the door, his nails growing a bit longer, before heading back to the table where Mallory and Allan sat.
1312221121111111111111.title: Jarrod makes it back to the table

13122211211111111111111.content:
As the waiter appeared at the table, Jarrod brushed his hand up to tuck a strand of hair behind his ear and noticed something smooth and dangly hanging from his earlobes. It puzzled him, for a moment, as his fingers traced over the smooth surface of the earrings. Still, as he turned his attention to the food, his mind let it go.

Mallory, smiling still, picked up her fork and glanced askance at her father who was engaged, rather happily, in a discussion with Allan and completely ignorant of the changes going on with him. She had watched him coming from the bathroom, hair long and flowing down his back, blonde curls, and from the short look, baby blue eyes (much better than the somewhat listless brown eyes that he had before) How had all these changes happened, she wondered for a moment, before she just shrugged and went back to her food.
13122211211111111111111.title: Food appears

1312221121111111111112.content: Who does he bump into?
1312221121111111111112.title: Jarrod runs into someone unexpected

choices: Jarrod gets a bit flustered but can't understand why
He brushes it off as nothing important
13122211211111111111122.content:
"Darren!"

Jarrod's younger brother blinked a few times and then shook his head with a smile. "Hey, Jarrod...what are you doing out here?"
13122211211111111111122.title: His younger brother, Darren

131222112111111111111221.content:
Jarrod felt his face flushing and brought a hand up to his cheek, feeling the warmth that radiated from it underneath his softening palm. Darren just smiled a bit and reached over, giving his brother a warm hug that sent little bolts of energy shooting through his body. "Is Mallory out with you?"

"Y-Yes...she's over there..." he whispered, pointing in the direction of the table.
131222112111111111111221.title: Jarrod gets a bit flustered but can't under...

choices: Mallory calls for her uncle to join them
1312221121111111111112211.content: Darren spotted his niece sitting with his brother's neighbor at the table and waved, smiling warmly as the little girl responded with an enthusiastic wave of her fork in response. The man, spotting Darren, gave a nod of his head but seemed otherwise nonchalant of everything and returned to his meal. "Looks like I'm interrupting something?"
1312221121111111111112211.title: Darren sees Mallory and Allan

13122211211111111111122111.content: Jarrod quickly shook his head, feeling for a moment his hair brushing from side to side against the nape of his neck but dismissing the sensation almost immediately. "No, not at all," he responded quickly and found his hand reaching up and gently grasping Darren's arm. He was a few years older and had been bigger than his brother, who at 6'2" and 190, was not a beanstalk either, but now it seemed his hand could barely palm his brother's arm. "We were just going out to eat and Allan joined us." Jarrod felt his heart beating faster and faster in his chest, the sensation of being close to Darren and feeling the warmth coming from his touch took everything he had to just stand and not moan softly. "Honestly..." he dropped his voice.
13122211211111111111122111.title: Jarrod insists nothing's being interrupted

choices: Jarrod quickly excuses himself back to the table
131222112111111111111221111.content:
Darren smiled and took a small step forward, wrapping his arms around his brother and giving him a warm hug. Jarrod's cheeks immediately flushed and he felt his breathing becoming a bit shallow, his pulse racing, and it took every bit of control to prevent the moan from escaping his mouth. As they stood there embracing, small but very noticeable pricks of electricity shot from his chest, causing more of his body to feel flushed and warm. His mind, flooded with a lot of different signals and sensations, sat on the idea of why his chest was suddenly very sensitive to the touch but simply chalked it up to being a bit cold and moved on past it. Physically, underneath the sheer fabric of the silk shirt he was wearing, his chest sprouted two nubs that became very hard, very stiff, and every bit as pointy to reflect his body's very high state of arousal. The diameter of his areolas had expanded from the size of a dime to nickels as the color began to lighten from a dull brown towards a more creamy peach hue. Even the small hairs around the tips began to recede into his body.

"You okay, Jarrod?"
131222112111111111111221111.title: Darren gives Jarrod a hug

1312221121111111111112211111.content: Jarrod, feeling the overwhelming flush and heat surging through his body, merely nodded as he didn't trust his voice to sound anywhere near okay. With a pat on his brother's arm, he turned and moved quickly back in the direction of the table where Mallory was sitting. His mind was too busy trying to make sense of what he was feeling, what he seemed to be reacting to, that he didn't notice his hair had grown down past his shoulders, past the middle part of his back, and wound up only a few inches above the nape of his back. It was still a bit thin to be considered "healthy" but it was much longer than his normal cut and the color had turned it into a rich, lush golden hue.
1312221121111111111112211111.title: Jarrod quickly excuses himself back to the table

choices: Hobbling a bit back to the table
13122211211111111111122111111.content:
His mind too distracted by the feelings that were racing up and down his body, Jarrod failed to see the older man scooting his chair backwards as he was getting ready to stand up. The back of the chair impacted his hips with a slight jar, sending his foot out from under him.

"Oh, excuse me," he said quickly, turning to help Jarrod up. For his part, Jarrod smiled gently and nodded his head in embarrassment, feeling the need to bring his right hand up and brush a lock of his hair back behind his ear. His fingers traced across a set of dangling earrings and even then, the feeling was a bit off from the slim fingernails that were growing, ever so slowly, on his hands.
13122211211111111111122111111.title: A sudden bump leads to...?

choices: The manager comes over to check on him.
131222112111111111111221111111.content: He stumbled through an apology before he turned back and headed to the table where Darren and Mallory were seated. As he approached, he felt a bit awkward as his hips, throbbing a little from the solid wooden back of the chair, seemed to be a bit off. His gait, as a consequence, was shifting ever so slightly from a brisk business-like pace to a more sensual heel-toe strut. Jarrod didn't know what was going on with himself but still he just continued until he reached the table...
131222112111111111111221111111.title: Hobbling a bit back to the table

choices: Allen's starting to change a bit
1312221121111111111112211111111.content:
Jarrod shook his head a bit as he came back to the table. For the briefest of moments, he thought he saw his brother sitting at their table but, from a brief glance over his shoulder, he spotted Darren going back to another table in a different part of the restaurant. It was all very confusing to him.

"You okay, dad?" Mallory called out to him and Jarrod turned around and smiled, running his hand back to brush another lock of golden blonde hair out from his face and back over his ear. She saw the earrings and smiled. "Those are nice...you should wear them more often."

Jarrod felt them in his hand and turned his attention back to Allen, sitting across from him. "Sorry about that..."
1312221121111111111112211111111.title: A bit unsure of his own bearings...

choices: There's something a bit more going on
13122211211111111111122111111111.content: How's Allen starting to change?
13122211211111111111122111111111.title: Allen's starting to change a bit

choices: Decides not to bother and continues with dinner
Asks Allen to explain a bit
131222112111111111111221111111111.content:
Allen simply shook his head and turned back to Mallory, the two of them becoming engrossed in some discussion about what was happening during the day. For a brief moment, Jarrod blinked and wondered why Allen would be so eager to talk to Mallory about what went on in school that day, what happened with the gossip mill, and especially what was going on with some of the other students in the class. It almost...no, it definitely seemed like he not only wanted her view on things but had something to contribute. But how was that possible? It couldn't have been...right?

Jarrod...
131222112111111111111221111111111.title: He's getting much younger

choices: Jarrod has to use the restroom
Allen gets up and excuses himself
1312221121111111111112211111111111.content: Taking a moment to focus on the plate in front of him, Jarrod shook the strangeness from his mind and smiled slightly to himself. For years, Mallory had been a bit sad and lonely, despite all of the attention that he could lavish on her, so it was nice that she had gotten along with Allen so well right off the bat. As the two talked, Jarrod looked down at the salmon with salsa verde and brought a small forkful to his lips, blowing it just a bit to cool it down before the morsel of food disappeared into his mouth. As he chewed, Jarrod's lips slowly expanded and filled out to a noticeable shape and size that, while not cartoonishly big, definitely made it good for smiling, laughing, and other more assorted tasks.
1312221121111111111112211111111111.title: Decides not to bother and continues with dinner

13122211211111111111122111111111111.content:
As they finish up dinner, Jarrod looked over the table at Mallory and Allen, the two of them talking happily and excitedly about something that seemingly did not sound like it should come from an adult. It seemed strange, almost odd, that Allen appeared a bit smaller than when they had started out. But that wasn't possible. He only imagined that Allen's shoulders had shrunk a bit or that his height had dropped a little. Did he always have shaggy brown hair? Hadn't he been black haired?

"Dad?"

Jarrod blinked and shook his head slightly and smiled. "Sorry, just gotta go to the restroom a bit. Why don't you look over the dessert menu?" With Mallory smiling in return, he stood up and turned. Every step he took seemed to be a little bit off, his gait unknowingly to him having shortened a bit with the bottom of his slacks slowly starting to grow a bit softer as the fabric changed from denim to a semi-silk texture.
13122211211111111111122111111111111.title: Jarrod has to use the restroom

131222112111111111111221111111112.title: There's something a bit more going on

choices: She's checking up on her dad
Jarrod has a change of plan
1312221121111111111112211112.content:
Mallory had excused herself from Allan and made her way towards the restrooms when she spotted her father and uncle talking, though it appeared that her uncle was doing all of the talking while her father was trying to find some hole to dig himself into and bury completely. She paused, momentarily, at the sight of his dress shoes. Normally, they would be a dark black hue, leather, tied at the ankle and suited just appropriately, ever the military-brat in him. This time, though, his shoes seemed less rounded and the toe area in particular had taken on a slightly pointed shape to them. The laces themselves seemed to have become smaller, almost as if they were being absorbed back into the leather material that made the rest of the shoe. But that was crazy, her mind settled on, and she turned her attention back and waved at her uncle.

"Hey..."
1312221121111111111112211112.title: Mallory joins them

choices: They take a short-cut and get lost...thanks, GPS!
1312221121112.content:
"Heard good things about that new Chinese place, Wong King," she ventured as the car pulled out of the driveway.

Allan blinked a few times. "That seafood place? Yeah, same here!" He turned and looked at Jarrod for a moment. "Want to try it?"

As he thought about the idea, Jarrod's hair, a very white-yellow color, slowly began to show some darkening around the roots. It was very subtle, almost easy to glance over, but Mallory was keyed into the change quickly. She couldn't really explain why she had known to look, or what she had known to look period, but she did notice it. That and the fact her father's hair, normally kept really neat and tidy, was already growing. It was still short, stylish for a man to have, but it looked as if it hadn't been cut or touched up in weeks.

"Sure...why not?"
1312221121112.title: Chinese is good this time of the day

1313.content: What are the genders of his children?
1313.title: Two children.

13132.content:
The sun peaked through the windows, offering its brilliant light into the bedroom of the girls bedroom. The mirror of the vanity glared and reflected this blinding light, doing away with the darkness that drowned the teen girls room.

As if on cue, the girls alarm, from her iPhone went off, polluting the scenery with the non-discrete default ringtone for the alarm; Obnoxious was the only term that could’ve been used to describe the awful tune that blared from the phone.

“Ughhh…” The girl groaned, tossing and turning in her bed. She was awake, the alarm ensured this. She refused to get up, the bed felt so nice, warm... Yet, despite the tranquility she felt at this moment, the alarms noise pollution guaranteed her peace would be disturbed.

She opened her eyes, slowly, hesitantly. “Geez… Can’t I sleep in for once…?” She moaned.

After another 5 minutes of just laying, sprawled about her bed, she rose, stretched her legs, arms, everything in an attempt to wake up. She gave a soft yawn and placed her feet on the floor below, still half-asleep, and proceeded to the restroom.

Her name? April Wills, a 17 year old girl and high-school senior. She dragged herself to the restroom, still attempting to wake up. Upon arrival, she turned on the sink and splashed her face with the cold water that erupted.

“That’ll wake you up!” She exclaimed. The cold sensation caused her to stand up straight at 5’5.”

“Time to get ready…” She softly said, as not to wake up her younger sister, who was probably still out cold somewhere in the house. She wet her caramel colored hair and brushed it to its straight, full length at a few inches past the shoulders.

Upon finishing getting ready, she stepped out of the steam filled restroom, the moment the door opened, the steam from the shower fled the room like there was no tomorrow. And, there she stood, clad in her PJ’s, which consisted of a pair of women’s running shorts and a tee shirt donning her schools mascot and logo.

“Wonder where Dad is…” She sighed, proceeding to the kitchen of their one-story house When she entered the kitchen, there April beheld a note, on the table. She rolled her eyes, knowing what this was, just by the looks.

“Let’s see where he is now…” She sighed, in frustration. April began to read the note.

“Sorry about this, I had to go on another short business-type trip. You know the routine; There’s an envelope containing some money for food and whatever else you’ll need/want, and some emergency contacts. Again, I’m terribly sorry, I hate doing this to you girls so often. You two take care of each other and, I promise, we’ll spend some time with each other next weekend. I’ll be back tomorrow at midnight. Sorry, again. –Dad”

“He’s always doing this… I’ve already lost count of how many times he does this! Cat’s gonna be so disappointed…”

“Disappointed about what?” A young voice chimed in. April looked to the entrance of the kitchen and found her younger sister, Catherine Wills, 15 years, standing there a big smile on her face. She had always been the optimist type.

April simply held up the note; Cat knew what it meant.

“Again? He said this weekend would be different!” She pouted, plopping herself down on one of the kitchen chairs.

“I sometimes wish we had a different Dad! Someone who was actually here for us!” She continued to pout.

This statement pushed April’s buttons. “Now, don’t you say that! He tries, he tries and you know it!” April fumed, defending her father.

“Yeah, of course he tries! Look how often he actually talks to us, seems to care for us!” Cat sarcastically retorted.

April stood silent, she did have a point. He was hardly there, and, for one reason or another, he thought that money compensated for the lack of interaction. April walked over to the envelope of money and simply stared at it. She knew she had to change the subject, for Cat.

“Well, Dad or no Dad, we can still have fun!” April smiled, taking a seat next to her younger sister.

From there, April reached into the purse she carried with her always and pulled out a crystal-clear rock, stone type object. Cat looked to the rock, then to April and immediately smiled.

“You know me so well! I absolutely adore that thing! We’ve had so much fun with that!”

“Yeah, all this time, and, still, I have no idea how it grants wishes like that… It’s so… weird.” April added, referring to the several years the pair had possessed the stone. Since elementary school had the two sisters owned and used it, all under the nose of their father.

“Like, do you remember that one time you got a bad grade in that math class, so, I turned into a copy of Dad and posed as him for a parent-teacher conference! Being a guy was so weird!” April continued.

“Or, there was that one time that that popular girl you hate skipped class! Remember? Since she was absent, I became a clone of her, went to school that day and made her look like a total idiot!”

Cat smiled, nodded and chimed in, happily. “Yeah! Those times were great! Not that you needed to pose as her to make her look stupid; She could do that all by herself.”

April and Cat laughed and continued to reminisce about all the times they had with this magical, wish-granting stone of unknown origins.

This went on for another hour or so, all without pause. Finally, April came to a revelation, of sorts.

“Hey, Cat?” April asked her sister.

“Yeah?” Cat responded.

“All those times we were talking about with the stone, like, me turning into Dad, or into that girl you hate, or even when I became a clone of you and you became a clone of me so I could take a test you didn’t study for…”

“Oh! Thanks for that, by the way! Thanks to you, I got the highest grade in the class! I still owe you big-time for that!” Cat said.

April smiled a devious grin before continuing.

“I’m actually glad you said that you owe me big-time. Because, I think it’s time you’ve returned the favor. I’ve always used the stone for you, and, not once have you used it for me! And, since Dad’s not going to be here till tomorrow at midnight, I think now’s the best time.” April proceeded.

Cat’s smile and optimistic attitude slowly faded there.

“Alright, I guess I had this coming… So, what do you want me to do?” Cat sighed.

“I’m glad you asked…” April smiled.
13132.title: Two daughters.

131321.content:
“Alright! Out with it! What do you have in mind?!” Cat asked in frustration, crossing her arms on the table before her.

All the while, April simply sat on her chair, beside Cat, with her devilish grin, plotting. Really, April had no plans for her sister, she just hinted towards ‘owing her’ just for fun. But, the more she thought about this concept, the more she rolled with it. As time continued to move forward, the idea sounded more and more appealing. After another few seconds of thinking, the figurative light-bulb lit above her head.

“Okay, if you want what I have in mind, you’ve got it!” April exclaimed. “You remember that guy I had that crush on, Logan, the one that was cheating on me with that other girl?” April asked, no hint of remorse in her voice.

Cat frowned at this. She indeed recalled, she knew that April was really interested in that guy, only for him to let her down like that. Cat pitied her sister for what had happened.

“Yeah, why?” She asked.

That sly grin, returned once again. It was clear to Cat that vengeance was on her mind, Cat wondered how she’d be involved in all this, though. “You remember how he and that girlfriend of his both work at that Movie-type store at the mall?”

“…Yes?” Cat hesitantly answered, really not wanting to know how she fit into this equation.

“Well, you know Adam Sterling, right? Well, I asked him just to hang out with me at the mall, alone, just to… Hang around me in an attempt to make Logan… Jealous. Adam said no…” April continued.

“Really?” Cat answered surprised that Adam had said no to hanging out with her, alone. Adam was the same age as April, almost all of the same classes. The two were best friends, and often hung out with one other girl, Andrea Cunningham. The three were best friends, and, everyone but April knew Adam had an insane crush on April. Why he refused her left Cat completely confused. Heck, Adam had actually openly told Cat that he liked her sister. You sometimes hung out with the three of them, April, Adam and Andrea, and this fact was painfully obvious. Apparently, not to April.

“Yeah, anyway, Adam said no, and, I’d still like a guy to go with and make Logan jealous… Need I say more?” April asked.

Cat was a smart girl, she immediately put one and two together and came to what April wanted of her.

“YOU WANT ME TO USE THE STONE TO TURN INTO A GUY.” Cat coldly stated.

“…” April sat silent for a moment, as if in an awkward position. “…Please..?” April asked, the twinkle of desire in her eyes, looking to Cat.

“But, that’s so weird! You want me to take you out, like, on a date?” Cat asked. “That’s just wrong!”

“No, not a date! I just want you to walk with me, maybe hold my hand, a hug or two, make it seem like we’re dating. I’m not interested in dating my own sister, that’s just freaky! I just want to make Logan a little jealous!”

No matter how April phrased it, the idea still sounded too weird for Cat to handle. She looked to April and already she saw April handing her the puppy-dog look.

“Please? Think about all the things I’ve done for you, the things we were just talking about. Come on! After that, I’ll owe you! I promise!”

Cat sighed. “This is going to be so weird! But, give me the dang stone!”

“Thank you, thank you, thank you soooo much! I owe you big!” April squeaked, handing her sister the stone.

Cat hesitated for a moment as she grasped the stone. She stood up, feeling a bit anxious. “You’ve become guys before, do you have clothes that I could wear?”

“Of course!”

“Here goes nothing…” Cat sighed, really not wanting to do this.

“I wish I was a 17 year old guy!” Cat exclaimed, eyes shut, not wanting to see the results.

April sat in her contentment, watching the show. As per usual, whenever a wish was made, a blinding light filled the room. When the light faded, Cat was still there, in her normal, teen-girl form. As usual, the change April witnessed was speedy.

First, Cat’s height shot up from her petite 5’4” to a booming height of 5’10.” She looked to be a really tall version of herself. Everything else followed, wasting no time. Her smooth, twig-like arms sprouted some short hair about the arms, stopping at the hands, a noticeable amount of muscle also sprouted. Her smooth, pale-white legs also had a lot more hair spread about them, developed also were a little more muscle there. Her feet and hands grew a lot larger, losing their feminine touch. April laughed a bit as her chest went flat under her tank-top. Her facial structure distorted and grew more masculine as facial hair germinated above and around her lips leaving her something of a beard, of a brown color. The soft features of her face faded as her mid-length, light-brown hair retracted to that of a clean-cut male. Her ‘female parts’ changed and shifted into a healthy, male reproductive system. The bulge that erupted from the now incredibly-tight-fitting girls’ running shorts made this known.

April smiled as Cat stood there, now a 17 year old boy looking incredibly ridiculous in girls’ shorts and that tank-top. The shorts and top struggled to keep themselves on this large body.

“Ugh… I feel so… Weird, but, strangely energized!” Cat exclaimed, stepping back a little at hearing the sound of her, or his, deep voice. He poked at the muscles of his arms. “This is kind of cool! I feel so… Strong.” He said. He then looked to down to his legs.

“Yuck! What’s with all the hair! Those things are nasty…” He said, feeling up his legs. “Still, this strength is sort of cool.” Cat reiterated. “And, feeling that thing between my legs is going to be something to get used to…” Cat uttered, still attempting to get used to that new voice.

April simply stood there and smiled. “You’re quite the looker, Sis.”

Cat smiled, still feeling a bit awkward as she looked herself over.

“Now, to get you out of those clothes… We can’t go out with you looking like THAT.” April said, pointing to Cat’s clothes. April looked him over from head to toe.

“Yup, this’ll work.” April smiled, leading Cat to her room to change into something more suited.

132111.content:
Tuesday was the day. And... That's all it was. Just the average weekday morning for 35 year old Jenna Robinson. And, there she stood in her kitchen, preparing a breakfast for her one & only son, John. Jenna took a sigh, and scanned her kitchen. Suddenly, while scanning, something peculiar caught her eye, an object gibing off a mesmerizing shine and twinkle. Jenna walked over to the item, it was... A necklace.

"Strange," she thought to herself, "It surely isn't any piece of jewelry of mine... And there's no way it's John's." Jenna again thought, holding the necklace up, looking over it carefully.

The necklace was a glimmering silvery stone, held by a silver chain.

"Well, it won't hurt anyone...," Jenna thought aloud, giving her justification for placing the necklace upon herself. But, as soon as she placed it upon her neck, a strange feeling came over her body and mind, and quickly vanished. "Weird..." She thought,heading to the kitchen to proceed cooking her son's meal.

Jenna suddenly heard footsteps, these steps drew nearer with each passing moment, and suddenly John was in the kitchen with her, with nothing to say to her, as per usual.

Jenna and John, didn't talk too much at all, She, as his Mother, always offered words of advice and conversation, though, to her, it seemed that the more she tried, the more he'd push away. The relationship between the two had been a drifting one for quite a while now, and it seemed as if this splitting trend was bound to continue, and, as much as Jenna hated it, John would continue to push her away.

And, also as usual, Jenna snatched the opportunity at conversation with her son.

"Morning, Son! How are t-"

"Fine, mother," He instantly shot back at her, before Jenna even finished the question, almost as if he knew what to say and when.

"That's good, that's good," Said she, shrugging it off. Finishing the cooking of his breakfast.

She placed the plate of food before him, and without a "Thanks, Mom," or a "Appreciate it," or any words at all, John quickly devoured the food on the dish, gave an abrupt goodbye, and went off to school.

"What just happened?," Jenna asked aloud, confusedly.

After he left, Jenna took a seat on her couch in the nearby living room, and drifted into thought.

"He and I used to have such a close relationship. Now that he's a teenager, it seems as if everything's beginning to change." She thought, deeply. "Great!" She exclaimed sarcastically. "First I lost my husband in that damn divorce, and now my own son!," She shouted, her voice quivering. Suddenly, she found that she was in tears over the fading Mother & Son relationship.

"I just wish I could understand what goes on in that boy's mind..." Jenna wished. Suddenly, she looked at the necklace. The stone on the necklace was giving off a very bright, almost blinding light. and with that her wish was granted.

Jenna looked around, confused. "What just happened?" She thought to herself. She felt fine, but something felt wrong to her. She just couldn't point her finger on it. She got up and looked down as to look over herself. When she did, what she found shocked her incredibly.

"Holy crap, I'm my own son!!!" She instantly covering her mouth, realizing that she had his voice, too.

She went to her bathroom to look at herself in the mirror. It was true, she was indeed her 14 year old son, John. At least physically.

She looked down again and found herself in Jeans, a pair of Vans, and a T-shirt with some band on it. She looked at her face and found it to be exactly like her Son's. She spoke and found she had her son's voice. She looked about her body, and felt much younger, more agile, and significantly stronger. As strange as it was, y'know, Jenna being her own son, it felt great.
"I sure wish I knew what caused this!!!" She exclaimed in her new, masculine voice. With another flash of light from the stone, she knew everything.

"It's the stone that's making this happen!!!" After realizing that much, she changed back to her 37 year old, woman self.

With one more light, she looked upon herself to find she was back to her female self.

With a sigh of relief she gazed upon the stone, feeling feelings and emotions of all sorts: Wonder, fear, anxiety, amazement, happiness...

"Imagine the things I could do with this thing in hand..." She thought aloud... Staring in total awe at the stone.

(What Happens Next?}

She took a deep breath and said in a voice just above a whisper "I wish I was seventeen years old".

Jenna did not notice anything at first. Shit, it didn’t work, she thought until she looked closer and noticed the lines on her face were gone. She looked down at saw her stomach and hips receding. The extra weight that she had accumulated since college was disappearing. She felt her body shrinking a couple of inches as she crossed the threshold of adulthood. The whole process took less than thirty seconds.

13211111111111.content:
As the door opened, Jenna got up from her chair and repeated her wish in her head one final time. She had rehearsed it at least a dozen times over the past hour. The wish was in two parts. They were both simple and specific. She was totally burned out from being a single mother. She needed a break.

As her son John entered the room, Jenna pointed to him and said in a voice barely louder than a whisper. "I wish you are a 40 year old single father, and that I am your 17 year old daughter."

John saw the teenage girl in the living room, and swore she reminded him of someone. "Who ..." he started to say, but then he noticed something was wrong with his voice. He also noticed he was growing. By now he had already passed his twentieth birthday and was getting older. He saw his body grow more muscular as he passed thirty years of age. His attire was also changing. His sweater and blue jeans were morphing into a white shirt, black dress pants and black jacket. His school bookbag was replaced by a black leather briefcase. As the progression wound down, he started to put on some weight in his waist and thighs.

As John stared at Jenna, he was confused by the rapid progression. For a brief moment, he thought she was his mother. He remembered that his mother's name was Jenna. He then recalled that his mother been dead for ten years. At that moment, his brain was adjusting to the change in reality. No, Jenna was his daughter. He named her after her grandmother. Her mother left them when she was five.

John shook his head. He must have been working too hard. He turned to her and said. "How was school today, Jenna?"

Jenna smiled in satisfaction. "It was fine ... Dad" she answered, emphasizing the last word.

John proudly looked at his daughter as he put down his briefcase. "Well, shouldn't you be in your room studying? You have an English test tomorrow"

Jenna's eyes widened for a second, and then said. "Yeah, Dad. Thanks for reminding me."

Jenna left the living room and headed towards what used to be John's room. She opened the door and discovered that it had changed. The bed, the dresser and the computer were still there, but everything else had changed. The walls were painted pink instead of blue. The posters of Peyton Manning and Wilson Chandler were gone. In their place were posters of Justin Briber and One Direction. Jenna opened the closet and saw cloths of a teenage girl. On the table next to the computer were a pile of high school books along with notebooks. All the evidence was conclusive. This was her room.

With satisfaction Jenna jumped onto her bed and stared at the ceiling. Everything had worked according to plan. She was now a teenage girl, and John, who an hour before was her 14 year-old son, was now her 40 year-old father. And except for her, nobody else knows that reality had been altered.

Jenna grinned as she looked at the stone on her neck. She was going to have so much fun with this, she thought.

As she was musing, she heard a sound coming from the drawer of the computer table. She opened it and saw an iPhone. Someone was trying to call her. She picked up the iPhone and said. "Hello"

"Jenna" the person at the other end answered back. Somehow she recognized the voice. It was ...

132111111111111.content:
"Yes ... Abby" Jenna answered. She recognized the voice as that of Abagail Walters. Abby, as her friends called her, was on the girls basketball team of John's high school. Her high school, she corrected. She forgot for a moment that she was the high school student now.

"Jenna" Abby's said, "I've been trying to reach you for nearly an hour. Why aren't you here at the gym? The game stars in twenty minutes."

"The game" Jenna asked, not knowing what Abby was talking about.

"You know, Jenna" Abby's voice was definitely annoyed, “The game against Central High. If you're not here in nineteen minutes, the coach will kick you off the team for sure!”

As Abby was talking, Jenna saw a red basketball uniform prominently displayed on a coat rack in a corner. She realized that she was on the basketball team. She wondered what else she was in this reality.

“I’ll be there, Abby. Bye” Jenna hung up the phone. Jenna quickly took off her school cloths and put on the uniform. She had to get to her school gym, but how? She then remembered the stone she was still wearing. Jenna closed her eyes and said. “I wish I was in my teams’ locker room.”

Jenna opened her eyes and discovered she was no longer in her room. She was in a shower room. She ran out of the shower room and saw herself in a locker room with about a dozen teenage girls. All of them were dressed in the same type of uniform Jenna was wearing. One of them, a tall black girl waved to her. It was Abby Walters, the same person she spoke her phone just a few minutes before.

“Jenna” Abby ran up to her. “How did you get here so fast?”

“I ran here” Jenna answered.

“That’s impossible” Abby protested. “I was on the phone with you just a few minutes ago.”

“No, it was half an hour ago” Jenna stated. She then touched the stone and continued. “I wish you would believe me”

Abby shook her head, and then recalled she had called her friend Jenny a half hour before. She must’ve been mistaken.

“Alright, girls” a woman in her early forties with a whistle on her neck and carrying a clipboard called out to the group. “We hit the court in ten minutes!”

With that Jenna started to panic. In her previous life she had never even watched a basketball game, much less play in one. She wouldn't last two minutes on the court. Unless, of course, she used the stone to tilt the odds.

She turned back to her best friend Abby. “Could you excuse me, Abby. I'll be right back” She went to the bathroom around the corner. Her nose wrinkled from the smell coming from the toilets. She looked herself in the mirror and touched the stone and made yet another wish. "I wish I was the best female basketball player in the world."

Immediately Jenna grew to above 6' in height, and her body became more toned and muscular. She looked at her improved body and smiled. She was now more than a match for WNBA players ten years her senior.

"Jenna" she heard the coach call her. "Jenna Robinson. We're waiting for you."

"I'm coming" Jenna answered. She put the stone in the pocket of her uniform, stepped out of the bathroom and rejoined her teammates. Jenna was not surprised that none of them noticed that she had changed. "OK, girls" she shouted to them, "let's go kick some ass"

As Jenna ran onto the court, the entire gymnasium went to their feet. She realized they were all cheering for her. She felt more confident than ever.

The game was pretty much over by halftime. She scored 22 of the game's first 24 points. She would end up scoring 78 points, and she didn't even play in the fourth quarter. The Eastern Lady Bulldogs had clinched the conference championships with three games left to play.

When the players returned to their lockers, Abby called out to her friend. "Jenna, some of us are going to our to Fudrucker's to celebrate. Why don't you come with us."

Jenna considered, and replied ...

"Ah!" She exclaimed in relief, glad to finally be done with the day. She lay there, sprawled out about the couch, arms at her belly, legs wide open, not really caring that her legs were open and she wore a skirt.

She really liked the freedom of these little things, like sitting, or lying, with the legs open. She brushed this off, gave a smile and a twinkle about her eyes, reached for the stone at then end of her necklace and laughed.

"And don't thing I've forgotten about you, you lovely little wish-granting rock!"

"Now, what to do with you..." Jenna contemplated for a few minutes, thinking about her un-appreciating son, John, and how she could use a vacation, of sorts. The very thought made her giggle.

"A vacation from everything! A chance to get away from it all!" Jenna exclaimed, petting the stone as if it were a pet. "A way break from motherhood, work... Just for a little while, though... I really do love him..." she sighed, looking to a photo of John from the good ol' days of his younger years, when he was just a little boy. Innocent, cute, and lacking in that horrid teenage boy attitude. She really didn't understand him, his attitude, his perspective.

"Boys... Men..." She sighed. "I'll never understand why they act like they do..."

You smiled at the thought.

"I bet I'd be a good man... Yeah!" you laughed. "I understand women, what they want. I bet I could have them all over me!"

"I don't get why they complain so much..." she began... "No periods, no child-bearing, no motherhood... Just being able to get ready for the day in minutes time versus the extensive preparation women have to go through... No dresses or skirts, no having to worry about pervs staring at your legs or breasts... B being able to sit like this, all the time..." She proceeded, looking to her wide-open legs. "And being big and strong."

"Well, John'll be home any minute..." she got to her feet, a smile spreading across her face with her idea.

"I know what to do with you." she laughed at the rock, holding it firmly in her soft hands, as she brushed her soft, fragrant hair behind her ears.

"... Maybe John will learn to appreciate me this way." You smiled in confidence. "And... No going back for 24 hours..."

With a closing of your eyes and a deep breath in and out, you made your wish...

"I wish..."

13211111221.content:
Jenna smiled as she made up her mind what she wanted to be. When she was a girl, Jenna was an avid comic book reader. Her favorite characters were female superheroes, particularly Supergirl. She often had dreams that she was Supergirl, flying off to save the day. She grew out of it when she entered high school, but about a year ago she found a superheroine fan site on the Internet and her interest on the subject was renewed. Almost every day when she was in the house alone she scanned the web on her computer for superhero fanfiction, videos, and so on. She had even bought a costume that she wore at night after John went to bed.

Jenna stared at the wishing stone in front of her and all of her childhood fantasies returned. Could this stone really give her superpowers? There was only one way to find out.

Jenna went to her bedroom. By now she was committed. It was just a matter of the details.

As she entered the bedroom, Jenna looked at her watch. It was about quarter past four. She guessed John was hanging out with his new girlfriend Michelle. He would not likely be back before dinnertime. Under normal circumstances she would be annoyed with her son’s tardiness, but this time she did not mind being alone. Jenna’s thoughts then returned to the matter at hand. She took off her shoes, top and skirt, revealing only a bra and panties. She then put the stone on her neck and looked at herself in the mirror. Now what kind of superhero do I want to be, she contemplated. She first thought of becoming a Batman-like character, but she rejected that idea. She wanted to have powers, and Batman didn’t have any. She then considered two other possibilities. The first was to have all the powers of a certain fictional superheroine, like Supergirl or Wonder Woman. The second option was for her to wish for just one ability. The latter was far simpler, less likely for the wish to go wrong, but the first was more appealing to her.

After a few minutes, Jenna made her decision.

A few days ago Jenna watched The Fantastic Four on TV. Her favorite character was Susan Richards, AKA The Invisible Woman. She decided she’ll be The Invisible Jenna. She rubbed her fingers against the stone, and then turned said to it “I wish I was invisible”

She raised her head and looked into the mirror. She gasped in amazement at what she saw. Or more correctly, what she didn’t see. Her body vanished completely. There was no head, torso, arms, or legs. All she could see were her unmentionables and the stone on a string. It was as if they were suspended in mid air. It took her a few seconds for her to realize what had happened. The stone had granted her wish. She was invisible, but everything on her remained visible.

Jenna took off her underwear and threw them on the bed, and then took off the stone and carefully put in her jewelry box. If she somehow lost it she would remain invisible for the rest of her life, so she wasn’t taking any chances. She then went back to the mirror and saw in front of her an empty space where her naked body should be. A feeling of excitement went through her as she walked around the house. It was a little disorienting to look down and see nothing beneath her. She giggled to herself as she wondered how her son would react if he couldn’t see her now.

As the now invisible Jenna explored the house, she considered her condition. Being invisible would be useless if her cloths remained visible. It then occurred to her that the stone only made her invisible. It didn't give her the power to become invisible and visible again at will. As soon as she returns to normal she'll have to remedy that, and find a way to make her clothing invisible and visible as well.

She looked up at the clock and saw it was now quarter before 5. She would have to start dinner soon. She wondered if she should make herself visible again before John returns.

Jenna put the stone on the dresser and headed towards a chair next to her bed. She sat down, considering what to do. She wanted to be able to shrink to a certain size. It was just a question of how small she wanted to be. After a few minutes, she decided she wanted to be able to shrink to ...

132111112212.content:
F*ck it, Jenna thought as she decided she didn’t want some lame superpower like mind reading or invisibility. She wanted to be a real superhero, and real superheroes had at least three core abilities: flight, superhuman strength, and invulnerability. She looked at the stone again and thought of how her superpowers would operate. She could simply wish for the stone to give her the powers. Another idea was to wish for the ability to transform into a superheroine and back to a normal woman, ala Mary Marvel.

What did Jenna decide?
132111112212.title: She went the whole nine yards.

1321111122122.content:
Jenna decided she wanted to be like Mary Marvel. She was familiar with the DC comic book character. She was Mary Baton, an ordinary teenage girl who could transform into a superpowered young woman by saying the word ‘SHAZAM’, and back again with the same word. Jenna noted that Mary Marvel lacked some of the powers Supergirl had, like X-ray Vision, but she realized that could be fixed easily enough.


With her decision made, Jenna looked again in the mirror. She went through the wish several times in her head. Satisfied she knew what to say, she looked directly at the stone on her neck. “I wish for the ability to transform into a female with the same powers as the DC character Mary Marvel by saying the word ‘SHAZAM’”

After she made the wish, Jenna put the stone in her jewelry box and sat on a chair next to her bed. She was beginning to have second thoughts about it. Will it work? Did I say it right? What if something goes wrong? She spent about half and hour sitting on the chair until she looked at the clock and saw it was nearly 5PM. Her son could be back at any moment. Moment of truth, she thought as she got up and headed back to the mirror. She spread her legs and placed her hands on her hips in a power pose. She then closed her eyes, took a deep breath, and said one single word.

SHAZAM!

Did it work?
1321111122122.title: She wished for the Power of Shazam.

13211111221221121.content:
Immediately upon saying the magic word, Jenna felt a surge of electricity go through her entire body. It was like an electric shock, but it was far more intense. It wasn’t painful. Indeed, Jenna was beginning to enjoy the experience when it suddenly stopped after a few seconds. Her eyes still closed, she caught her breath and realized she felt different than before she uttered the word. It was hard to describe. It was like being in a swimming pool with only your head above water.

Did it work, Jenna wondered as she summoned the courage to open her eyes. After counting to three, she opened them and looked in the mirror. She gasped as she saw the figure before her. The first thing she noticed was that she was no longer in the underwear. She was now wearing a costume. It consisted of a sleeveless red top and matching miniskirt, a white cape which reached down to her hips, and a pair of gold colored high-heeled boots which stopped three inches below her knees. On her chest, warped slightly by a pair of DD-cup breasts, was a familiar symbol: a familiar symbol: a gold lightning bolt. Jenna then noted she was taller than before. She estimated her height to be about 6’, eight inches taller than before the change and two inches taller than her son. She could see her body was toned and muscular like an athlete. She looked up and saw the face of a girl of 18 or 19 years, which long red hair and blue eyes.

Jenna grinned and put her hands on her hips, clearly pleased with her new body. The costume she was wearing was a slightly less modest version of the one Mary Marvel wore in the comics. She was certain that she also had her abilities, and she was eager to try them out.

What superpower did Jenna try first?
13211111221221121.title: Yes

1321111122122112131.content:
Jenna decided that before starting her new career as a superhero, she needs to know if she could change back. She faced the mirror again and said in a deep and powerful, but youthful voice

SHAZAM!

Nothing happened. She was still a 18 year old Supergirl. She repeated the word, with the same result. She wondered why she didn’t change back, but the answer came to her. Idiot, she thought. I didn’t wish for the ability to change back. Slightly embarrassed at her lack of foresight, she took the wishing stone out of her jewelry box and put it back on. She went back to the mirror and said. “I wish to have the ability to return to my prior state by saying the word ‘SHAZAM’” She waited about ten seconds before saying the same word again.

Did Jenna change back?
1321111122122112131.title: She tried to change back to Jenna Robinson.

13211111221221121311.content:
As she said the word, Jenna saw something like lightning hit her square on the chest. It was followed by the same sensation she felt before. After it passed she caught her breath before looking in the mirror. She saw plain, ordinary 34 year old Jean Robinson in her underwear. Satisfied she could change bodies at will, she went over to her closet and got out some casual clothes: a blue blouse, blue jeans and tennis shoes. After putting on the cloths, she went to the dresser and opened the jewelry box. Her eyes widened when she realized the amulet was gone. She briefly panicked before remembering she was wearing it. She went back to the mirror and said ‘SHAZAM’. She instantly changed back into a beautiful, teenage Amazon wearing a red, white and gold costume. She relaxed as she saw the magic amulet on her neck. She guessed that everything on her, including the stone, disappears when she changes bodies. She then realized with horror that had she been wearing the stone when she first changed, she would not have been able to change back. She would’ve been stuck as a 18-year old girl forever.

Jenna cast that thought aside and examined her new body in the mirror. To say she was hot would be an understatement. She noted that the costume she was wearing was a slightly less modest version of the one Mary Marvel wore in the comics. She knew she was like Mary Marvel. It was then that she came up with a name for her newly created alter ego. Jenna Marvel. She laughed at that name.

Still wearing the stone, Jenna Marvel decided it was time to find out what abilities came with this body.

How did she find out?

Giddy with excitement, Jenna grabbed her purse, put on her purple jacket and left her house. She got into her car, started the motor, and drove it down her street. As she turned right on an intersection, she felt the stone still on her neck.

As she was thinking about where she was going to go ...
1321111211.title: She went out of the house.

13211112111.content:
"Alright, Jen..." Jenna thought to herself, filled to the brim with the excitement, the adrenaline rush that the stone, now wrapped around her pretty little neck, had to offer. "The only question left, where to now?" Jenna asked herself, examining the mysterious stone with each pause the road offered, considering each and every possibility out there, a glimmer in her eyes as she did.

The red light before her was all too long, but, in this case, she couldn't care less. So long as the stone was with her and she was with the stone, as long as this was, all was well. It had shaved so many years off of her, at lease, appearance wise. She looked to be a fit, young, stunning 21 year old woman in her prime. Prior to getting the stone, having the looks she had at this moment was but a dream that continued to fade as time flew, youth getting farther and farther from her sight.

Of course, being an older, more mature woman had perks she had not at 21. For example, the wisdom and the knowledge attained over the years. This wisdom included recognizing that she herself, at the age of 21, was a fool. Jenna managed to miss out on all that youth had to offer, having been pregnant with John at this age. No having fun, no lack of a care in the world, no revelry in youth for Jenna. No. She sat at her home, alone, dealing with the stress of being a single mother to a child who's father abandoned the both of them, all the while, attaining a college education.

"This is a second chance at life... An opportunity to get in on all the fun I missed out on..." She smiled, still taken back by the pretty young voice that emanated from her youthful body. From there, Jenna looked up from the stone, to the traffic light ahead. Still red.

"Feels like an eternity..." She sighed, leaning against the window to her left side. In reality, it had been but less than a minute. Just then, a thought hatched up in her mind. She looked to her left for oncoming traffic. Nothing. She looked to her right for oncoming cars. Nothing. Generally, seeing as it was somewhat early in the day, still morning, actually, most people were at working, leaving the streets mostly empty.

She smiled a sinister smile. "Screw it!" She exclaimed, switching her little foot to the gas pedal, offering a stomp. She then thought of what she did. She ran a red light. Perhaps it was the daredevil that this stone brought out in her, but she went for it, and, she was left absolutely thrilled, another shot of adrenaline running through her veins.

"YES!!" She exclaimed, believing herself to have escaped the situation without any damage, or, without any cops to be all over her tail. "And no repercussions..." She smiled, handling the wheel with one hand, the other hand leaning against the arm rest to her left. Just then, the obnoxious sirens blasted, the red and blue lights Jenna could see flashing from her mirror from a police car.

"UGH!" Jenna groaned, realizing she was one of the few cars on the road, therefore, this cop was after her. Reluctantly, she pulled over to the side of the road as the wailing of the police sirens came to a sudden halt as the car pulled over, right behind her. Jenna attempted to keep her head down, as she saw a figure approach through the rear view.

"Ma'am." An authoritative, stern voice called. Jenna recognized this voice to be the voice of a...
13211112111.title: ... she was caught by a police car for running ...

choices: "... Only if you promise not to do something like that again!"
"...Only if you allow me to take you on a little date tonight!"
132111121111.content:
"A male cop, huh?" Jenna smiled in her mind, again, a playful aura about her. Again did Jenna recall her youth. Her son, John, may not have known this, but, Jenna was indeed quite the woman, a woman who knew of her looks, who knew how to charm the male body, of course, only when necessary. Jenna knew she'd be lying to herself if she insisted that this would be the first time she sways herself away from a ticket from the police.

"Well, let's see if I've still got it." She thought in her mind, ready for the cop who continued to await a reply in the background, behind the un-lowered window. Time to play.

With a couple of more taps at her window, from the cop, Jenna slowly rolled down her window, all the while, offering the best puppy-dog, pouty face she could possibly have drummed up.

"Yes, officer, can I help you?" She said in the pouty voice of a young woman. The officer now looked absolutely stunned, lost in her looks, looking Jenna right in the eyes and offering no words. The officer even continued to blush a little, letting Jenna know that this whole affair could be considered a victory on her part.

Of course, the young cop before her, at this point, looked to have been bitten by the love-bug over Jenna. He was blushing towards her like a schoolboy over his crush. Jenna concluded that, judging by the officers looks, he was decently young, perhaps only a few years older than her 21 year old form, perhaps 23, maximum. And, Jenna couldn't deny that he was a looker. A clean look the officer had about him, short, clean-cut dark blonde hair, green eyes, a clean shaven face... Plus, the man looked to be in good physical condition. Jenna couldn't help but notice the arms he had on him, looking big and strong...

"Ugh..." The man sighed in a somewhat deep, pleasantly smooth voice. He scratched the back of his head still struck by Jenna's looks. "I n-n-noticed that y-you..." He paused a moment.

"That I what?" Jenna asked in a cutesy voice, cocking her head playfully. "Ran a red light?" Jenna asked, looking to the officer for an answer.

"Ugh... Yes, Ma'am. Ran a red light..." He sighed.

"Please, officer!" Jenna whined. "Please don't give me a ticket or anything like that! You have to understand! I have a good reason behind why I did that!"

"...Do you?" The officer asked, as if he were prepared to let her off the hook. Jenna laughed in her mind, amused that he was buying every word of it. Quickly, Jenna drummed up some fictitious excuse as to why she did that.

"Yes! Of course!" Jenna confidently exclaimed, clearing her throat. "Well, I'm nearly late for my class at the nearby university! And I have a huge exam that I've been studying night and day for, for weeks! It's all I've been doing! My social life has suffered, and, on top of that, I'm not one of the lucky ones who has scholarships and stuff to back her up! I have two part time jobs to help me pay for my tuition! All out of my pocket!"

The officer stood stunned. Amused, Jenna continued.

"So, you see, I can't handle a ticket right now! A ticket on top of all my other expenses...!" Jenna cried, beginning to whip up some pseudo tears. "I-I... I just can't afford that!" Jenna cried, her eyes offering only tears. "I... I just won't be able to handle all that debt! Please, officer Jennings!" Jenna continued, wiping away her tears, examining the nametag about the Officer.

"You look like such a good guy! Please, find it in your heart to let a poor little college girl off the hook!" Jenna plead, even clasping her hands and looking to him with glimmering eyes.

"Ugh..." Officer Jennings sighed. "Well, first off, you can just call me David." The man continued, removing his hat.

"Sure, David." Jenna added, reveling in victory.

"You... You get off this time."

"Oh my god! Thank you, David! You're the best!" Jenna sung, preparing to take off, only to be once more halted by Officer Jennings, or, rather, David.

"Wait!" He called. "Only on one condition..."

"Sure, anything!" Jenna smiled.

Officer David Jennings looked into her eyes and smiled before speaking...
132111121111.title: Man

choices: Linda Carmichael, a friend and fellow mother.
John, her son with a couple of boys and a girl his age; Skipping class!
1321111211111.content:
"Sure, of course, David!" Jenna assured.

"Okay, then, Ma'am." David sternly said as he placed his hat back on. He offered a soft smile before continuing. "You're off the hook, this time! See ya around!" David waved as he entered his car, slamming the door.

Jenna offered a smile and a wave as she watched the police car head off into the distance behind her, leaving Jenna in the dust.

"Yup!" Jenna giggled. "I guess this girl's still got it!" Jenna laughed, stomping her foot to the gas and continuing off, still carrying the burden of a dilemma unsolved.

"I still don't know where i'm headed to!" Jenna whined, lowering the volume of the pop station on her radio. "I mean, c'mon! What's there to do at this hour anyway..." Jenna thought, pondering options.

"Let's see... We've got the beach that's not too long a drive... But, maybe later, when it's warmer... Then there are the bars, but, all the dysfunctional creeps hang there at this hour... Hmmm..." Jenna pondered as she drove along until something caught her attention.

She gave a peculiar look to the clothes she donned. Unfortunately, when the wish was made real, her clothes did not change to fir her age. Nope, the only fitting, suited thing that she wore was that purple leather jacket, which didn't even work well for the rest of her outfit. About her chest, she wore a tee shirt donning the mascot of her son's high-school, and, below that, a pair of mom-jeans with a pair of white sneakers. All of which, jacket aside, failed to fit her now much more petite form.

"These things are so not working for me..." Jenna sighed, giving a look of disgust to the mom-jeans she wore.

As she drove along, as if on cue, she saw a sign, an advertisement for the local shopping mall. "Woodsboro Indoor Shopping Centre and Mall, next right" the sign read, underneath these words, an extensive list of shops the mall had to offer, a vast majority of which clothing stores.

"Just what I need! Right on time!" Jenna giggled as she sped up, passing other cars she deemed too slow, all followed by a sharp right in the direction of the mall. After only a few minutes of passing a few shops and hotels, she saw it, that is, the parking lot to her destination; The vastly sized Woodsboro Indoor Shopping Centre and Mall, or, what the locals just referred to as 'The Mall.'

Fortunately, the day was still young and plenty of parking spaces were still available, an event that sparsely occurred at any other point in the day, particularly the nights of the weekends, when all the younger people would be out and about, doing only who-knows-what.

With a click of her keys, the doors to her car were locked and she walked towards the mall, which, given the parking conditions, was far from a long walk.

"I can't believe I'm gonna be seen wearing this stuff... So dang embarrassing!" Jenna continued along, entering the mall.

Jenna looked around the inside and smiled. The aromas the food court had to offer filled the place, the soft, monotonous sounds of the elevator-like music could be heard echoing through all parts of the large building, and all it had to offer. The chitter and chatter of people could also be heard, even at this hour, when the place was considered to be 'dead.'

Jenna, at this point, given that whole affair with the school-boy of an officer back there, walked up to one of the many tables the food court had to offer and sat down, leaning on the table before her.

In these moments, Jenna simply sat there, taking it all in. She knew she should be at work right now, yet, here she was, as a 21 year old at the mall, ready to take on all that this young life had to offer, be it good or bad. All the while, not a single soul seemed to notice. Life goes on.

"And all thanks to you!" Jenna laughed, giving the stone at the end of her necklace a small kiss. As she was preparing to get to her feet and continue the day, though, something caught her eye... No! Not something, someone. Yes, someone in this very food court, walking about.

"Hey..." Jenna uttered, recognizing this very person, then beginning to walk up to this person who was...
